reviews.review: very fun and has a lot of horror references
A match will never be "balanced" it takes real skill and a real learning curve in order to play, however it is one of my best games.

I've played the Game now for about 900 hours.
50/50 as Survivor/Killer.

I cannot recommend the Game, for the bad balancing and for the publisher behavior isn't really reacting on it.

Biggest problem is, that for killers its worthwhile to camp and tunnel survivors and still get enough bloodpoints.
For Survivors rounds like that are definitels NO FUN at all.
That problem is know for long, but nothing really happens to stop that.
also the game often gets extremely unbalanced if new killers are introduced - not necessarily for the new killer.

I've given that game a lot of chances, to "get better", but it never happens and i'm very sorry for that, because i really love the scenery, the look, the killers, survivors...but i hate the balancing.
This game is rife with hackers

Una puta mierda de juego te toca el calvo de mierda y con las cadenitas te mata si o si . no se puede hacer nada los killer estan infinitamente mas roto que los survivor . definitiva UNA PUTISIMA MIERDA
NFT? More like No Fucking Thanks. They barely fix the game and the NFT thing is just a straw that broke the camels back.

This game isnt what it used to be. They charge for everything. Most games give out free content with downloads. DBD does not you have to pay for any new killers/survivors. They ruined the game buy nerfing killers. They still havent enabled cross progression.. its been years.. makes me feel like its for money. You know since they can basically charge someone twice for the same  killer/dlc/survivor. It feels like the makers of this game only care about the financial gain.  I think people will be switching over to VHS soon.

Mir macht das Spiel sehr viel Spa√ü und ich kann es echt jedem weiter empfehlen. Besonders mir freuenden macht es Spa√ü und man kann es auch super gut alleine Spielen. Die Steuerung ist sehr einfach und es gibt vom spiel aus auch sehr viele tutorials  oder tipps wie man z.b das macht oder das macht etc.

NFT Game sucks Behaviour sort yourselves out
They don't even try to fix their game. Adding NFTs just reveals their hunger for more money.
Ta gra potrzebuje naprawy, a nie kolejnych DLC i punkt√≥w w ramach przeprosin.

Pros: You can play good and enjoy some competition

Cons: T bagging at the exit gates, end game chat, no time to relax, always competitive, horrible ranked system as of currently, getting tunneled, bad teammates, and my personal favourite the game itself
do wyjebania olana gra przez tw√≥rc√≥w pomimo potencja≈Çu , co≈õ pr√≥bujƒÖ ale lipa
very fun while you geting drunk
This game is incredible! so much content and i am excited to buy into the NFT's for it! this is going to be amazing!

It's one thing to openly state before a DLC comes out that it will support NFTs (as it should have happened). It's another thing entirely to plan months in advance to make the new DLC character models into NFTs, not inform the players of your involvement, sell the DLC, then wait until after a large portion of players purchase it to inform them that their money was used to support NFTs... I really enjoyed this game and thought the developer, BHVR, at least had basic morals.. if not morals, at least some basic business ethics. Such a disappointing end to an otherwise fun game.

playing as killer will have you wanting to kill yourself, in this game you can deal with glitchy characters and game balancing in the worst way possible - have you ever wanted to experience babysitting 4 crybaby children each game you play? then dead by daylight is for you!
NFT's. Atrocious progression system, addons allow for inconsistent game balance and unfun game experience.

Even though i have sunk over 200 hours into this game (at the time of this review) i can still safely say that this game is not worth getting into if you are new to this title, This game has quite possibly one of the most toxic fanbases i have seen to date, The amount of short tempered individuals that call foul when they start losing is ENORMOUS, from twitch streamers to players who want this game to be fun, nobody is safe from the toxicity that this very game pushes onto you.

In terms of other aspects like gameplay and balancing, this is a game that has yet to be solved (at least by the devs) in terms of balancing. either one side is op, or the other, after 200 hours of playing, I have accepted that this game will never definitively be fair no matter what patch comes next. 

Then theres the "fear factor". This game is by no means scary, at least not anymore it's not. after a while the "horror" aspect goes away entirely and becomes more of an actual game than a horror game.

BHVR don't give a shit about the game. Only moved by money, takes years to fix issues (years to give trapper 2 traps). Slow to fix bugs, but quick to put out cosmetic that are more expensive than the DLCs. Shame on them

I have come back to change my review from where I would recommend the game despite its flaws and toxic community to not recommend the game for the same reasons.

I have played everything from FPS's to MOBA's and I have never in over a decade encountered a more toxic un-fun community in my life. While there are good sports still in the game and some lovely streamers in the community they are unfortunately outweighed by the thousand of players who will spam you, tell you to KYS and generally just try to ruin your day.

The game has been absurdly one sided since day one and they have kept it this way, any time there is a buff or nerf to one side they also change the other side respectively to keep the game in this state. No matter how good you are against people of similar skill you feel completely powerless due to the games lack of balance.

Its a real shame because the game can be really fun, hell I will probably come back to it in the near future. But in its current state due to the devs and the players alike I cannot and will not recommend the game
soy manco pero de poquito intentare el 360

I really enjoyed playing this game, especially with friends. However, I can't morally justify supporting a company that values NFTs and quick cash more than the actual quality of their game and the environment. It's a shame what this game has become...
such a fun game. Brilliant for any horror fan! would 100% recommend

Do not buy the Hellraiser DLC as it supports NFTs.

Aside from that, the game is good.

I love this game so much but its so effin HARD to love it. Buggy af, DC penalties for legit crashes, hackers taking the game hostage, Pinhead no longer cooms, NFTs? Seriously? I love the game but hate the direction its going.
I think we did a pretty good...job so far
I love this game but its incredibly disappointing to see Behaviours greed and disregard for environment with the involvement in NFTs now.
Used a DLC to support NFTs and didn't tell the players about this for over a month despite knowing about the NFTs for months in advance.

This game was launched in 2016 and it still doesn't work properly. They can't release an update that works completely, the community is disgusting, you have to pay to even breathe. You need to spend 2000 hours just to unlock the original characters if you can't pay for DLCs and that's without taking into account the time needed to gather resources to level up each character. The grind sucks, the game is poorly optimized and Behaviour doesn't care for those who have been playing this for a long time. VHS will launch soon, it will be free, without the unnecessary grind. Wait for it to be released, it's better than throwing your money and your time away here. You deserve better than Behaviour can offer.
never more have i wanted to kill myself than opening dead by daylight. Each day i return to this game my sanity slips further and further from my grasp.
Game devs kind of feel scammy with the NFTs and removing the Hellraiser voicelines without disclosing it before everyone bought the DLC and character. Have a very negative feeling about the company.
this game can fucking suck my nuts

I recently switched to PC but on console I have 650+ hours in this game, I would recommend this game to people because of it's fun roster of both survivors and killers! I would also recommend this to people because of the interesting ways perks and abilities work together to make awesome game mechanics and encounters with other players!

I just can't recommend this game anymore. What once was fun is just frustrating and highly lopsided.  This isn't the game I originally bought and it's unfortunate how much it has changed for the worse.

Not only is the game riddled with bugs, hackers are becoming more and more commonplace. It‚Äôs clear that the company (at least the higher-ups) don‚Äôt really care much for it‚Äôs player base as long as they continue making money from cosmetics and whatnot all else is turned a blind eye to. You can play if you want, but as for spending money on this game I would highly advise against it. Reported bugs, glitches, and hacker have been repeatedly reported by players and BHVR has turned a blind eye to that and instead banned mods and added penalties for disconnecting when the game has a huge connectivity issue even on pc, I‚Äôm not even going to get into the huge list of problems console players are facing. Players cried out and begged them not to add SBMM and they did, shrugged their shoulders at how it turned out and simply said ‚Äúwell imagine if it worked! Wouldn‚Äôt that have been great? Welp have fun!‚Äù Then the icing on the cake was purposely omitting the fact that the newest chapter (the hellraiser one) was tied to NFT‚Äôs because they did not want to affect their sales of said character and cosmetics. I really hope they can look at the state of the game, listen to the community, including people who are paid to play the game and see that things need big changes in order for the game to survive but as of right now, as long as they can grab a quick buck from players I only see things getting worse and worse from here. This is a slippery slope and the worst part is the people who are going to suffer the most are the people who have dedicated their time and money into this game and those at the company who genuinely care but are unable to do anything because their hands are tied‚Ä¶
